intro: Otopappus acuminatus, commonly known as the sharp-headed fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Its yellow flowers are surrounded by pale green bracts, giving it a distinctive appearance. Otopappus acuminatus is known for its ability to thrive in arid conditions and is often found in foothill and mountainous regions.
